page.title: 15Industrial Estates
page.content: Aberdeen's first{Industrial Estates in the 50's and 60's, at Northfield and Mastrick, were planned prior to the discovery of North Sea Oil and Gas. However, with the advent of this, a need was recognised for many more Industrial sites and consequently several new Estates were designated. { {Kirkhill Industrial Estate, Dyce}is one of this new generation of eststes. Of the Industrial Estates in Aberdeen at present, something like 50% of those have been developed in the last decade. Kirkhill, at the moment, has 55 acres developed, but this is ultimately expected to extend to 232 acres. The erection of Industrial premises has mostly been carried out by the private sector with the exception of some smaller Unit Accommodation in Grampian Region owned Advance factories.
